title: What is Animal Magnetism and its Various Theories: An Overview of its History and Effects?
first_phrase: This last part of the text delves into the different theories and techniques used in animal magnetism practices. It starts by providing a background of the different terms and their widespread usage through literature and science. The various theories of doctors and scientists such as Heidenhain, Bernheim, and Braid are discussed in detail, as well as the different techniques used by magnetizers such as Lafontaine and Teste. The manifestations of somnambulism are explored, including both natural and induced states. Lastly, the idea of a magnetic fluid and its existence are debated, with some experts believing in its existence, while others await conclusive evidence.

XIV - Le Fluide magnétique Y a-t-il, n'y a-t-il pas un fluide magnétique? Mesmer, de Puységur, d'Eslon, Deleuze, du Potet, Lafontaine et nombre d'autres magnétiseurs , croyaient à ce fluide, et beaucoup de médecins y ont cru avec eux. Parmi les savants contemporains, M. Charles Richet, directeur de la Rente scientifique, et le docteur Dumontpallier, n'osent pas se prononcer catégoriquement. Ils attendent. Mais un autre savant, le docteur Baréty, de Nice, n'a pas attendu. Il a publié une brochure Sur les -propriétés de la force neurique rayonnante[16], et il doit donner prochainement une étude complète sur la matière. Sa théorie a naturellement été très combattue. La plupart des médecins ne l'admettent pas. * * * C'est par l'action du fluide que les anciens magnétiseurs expliquaient les phénomènes produits par les passes à distance.
last_phrase: In conclusion, while the existence of magnetic fluid is still not proven, the study of human magnetism and its effects is still ongoing. The debate between magnétiseurs and hypnotiseurs persists, although some hypnotiseurs have recognized the existence of some of the phenomena attributed to magnetism. Ultimately, the use of magnetism as a medical tool remains controversial and even banned in some countries. Despite this, the study of human magnetism continues to be a topic of interest for many.
